hedline.hl2: Building Partially Collapses in Manhattan; No One Is Hurt

abstract.p: Three-story vacant brick building being prepared for demolition partially collapses near busy intersection in Manhattan (S)

block.p: A vacant building near SoHo that was being prepared to be demolished partially collapsed near a busy intersection yesterday, but no one was injured.
The three-story brick building, at East Houston and Mulberry Streets, was to be the site of an 11-story residential high-rise, officials said.
A vacant building near SoHo that was being prepared to be demolished partially collapsed near a busy intersection yesterday, but no one was injured.
A vacant building near SoHo that was being prepared to be demolished partially collapsed near a busy intersection yesterday, but no one was injured.
The three-story brick building, at East Houston and Mulberry Streets, was to be the site of an 11-story residential high-rise, officials said.
The city's Department of Buildings ordered that demolition preparation work at the building be stopped March 22 because of an unspecified violation, according to city records.
Then on Thursday, the city ordered the building to be braced with cables, records show.
Those cables were wrapped around the building when it collapsed on two sides about 4 p.m. yesterday.
''It was a big bang,'' said Joseph Hamboussi, who works at Nolita House restaurant on East Houston Street, between Mulberry and Mott Streets.
